Understate: The claim may understate the fact that USPS "Forever Stamps" are not considered "second-class mail" and are processed at the same speed as other mail.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that items sent with "Forever Stamps" are processed more slowly.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that "Forever Stamps" being considered "second-class mail" automatically leads to slower processing, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why some people believe that items sent with "Forever Stamps" are processed more slowly, which are not addressed in the claim.
